title: Fruit Colors
subtle: Concept (nonfiction), 31 words, Level A (Grade K), Lexile BR10L
description: What fruit can be yellow? What fruit can be blue? In the book Fruit Colors, students will read about the many colors fruits can be. Students will have the opportunity to classify information as well as ask and answer questions as they read. Detailed, supportive photographs, repetitive sentence patterns, and high-frequency words support early readers.
meta: blue, fruits, green, orange, pink, purple, red, yellow
Use the reading strategy of asking and answering questions to understand text
Initial and Final Consonants : Discriminate initial consonant /p/ sound
Color Words : Recognize and use color words

Promote higher-order thinking for small groups
or whole class
